channel.title: DryBasic
channel.description:
DryBasic Include 1.0.0a by Can
If you read my post about "Hold Mouse Detection Talk" you know already why I made this include file, that I named "DryBasic". It is simply used when you want to use some safe and fast BASIC functions, but you dont want to load the whole srl include. And you are too lazy to code the functions in your scripts yourself.
The include file includes the following commands.
DryType(text: String); Types in keystrokes in a human like maner. Altho basic, it is undetectable.
DryTypeSubmit(text: String); Types in keystrokes in a human like maner. Altho basic, it is undetectable. When it is done typing in the message, it submits the string. (Pushes enter).
DryClick(dcdc: Boolean); Improved undetectable mouse click. use, DryClick(true); for left click, and DryClick(false); for right click.
DryDoubleClick; Makes a undetectable doubleClick. Use this rather than using "DryClick" twice, as drydoubleclick is made undetectable. when calling dryclick twice in a row might get detected because of the lack in wait(x); that is added to drydoubleclick.
Place the file in your INCLUDES folder. When making scripts with theese functions remember to "include the include" first with this code of line: {.include drybasic.txt}
PS. I would love feedback, and if you actualy make a script using dryBasic please give me a note ;)
Enjoy, love -Can

item.title: DryBasic
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

You could of just done[scar]procedure DryType(Text : String; Submit : Boolean);
var
D1: Integer;
begin
For D1:= 1 to Length(Text) Do
begin
Wait(Random(200) + 30);
SendKeys(StrGet(Text,D1));
end;
if (Submit) then
SendKeysVB(’{ENTER}’, True);
end;[/scar]

Read full topic

item.title: DryBasic
item.dc:creator: @Mad_Cow Mad Cow
item.description:
@Mad_Cow wrote:

[quote=“Can, post:6, topic:16150”]Hello, and thanks for the feedback Mad Cow.

I will start with answering the top of your post
It may seem like it is the same thing, but it is not, one submits the info, and the other one dont.

I quote a line from the submit function:
drytext:= drytext + chr(13);

You dont find that line in drytype. So they are not the exact same.

Anyways, you are offcourse perfectly right when it comes to the fact that i can make the function with true/false so i get both the functions in the same package. This will certantly be made for the next version. Thanks

If you read the entier topic on “Hold mouse detection talk” you would found out that, yes. What you say is true. That thing is found in function “Mouse”. However, many of the other srl functions such as “Cmouse” (Cmouse is the main clicking procedure, as Mouse move the mouse to x location first) etc dont use it.

Hope this clearify some of your concern. I must also say once more that this include is NOT made as an option to srl. It is simply an alternative when you need BASIC commands for your script, but you dont want to include the heavy srl include. It does prove some uniqness anyways.

Love
-Can

Ps, thanks once more for the feedback and support![/quote]

Ah alright. Perhaps you could add some procedures like:
-A smooth mouse(Just use MoveMouseSmoothEx)

And yea. It looks alright,
Mad Cow

Read full topic

item.title: DryBasic
item.dc:creator: @Can Can
item.description:
@Can wrote:

Hello, and thanks for the feedback Mad Cow.

I will start with answering the top of your post
It may seem like it is the same thing, but it is not, one submits the info, and the other one dont.

I quote a line from the submit function:
drytext:= drytext + chr(13);

You dont find that line in drytype. So they are not the exact same.

Anyways, you are offcourse perfectly right when it comes to the fact that i can make the function with true/false so i get both the functions in the same package. This will certantly be made for the next version. Thanks

If you read the entier topic on “Hold mouse detection talk” you would found out that, yes. What you say is true. That thing is found in function “Mouse”. However, many of the other srl functions such as “Cmouse” (Cmouse is the main clicking procedure, as Mouse move the mouse to x location first) etc dont use it.

Hope this clearify some of your concern. I must also say once more that this include is NOT made as an option to srl. It is simply an alternative when you need BASIC commands for your script, but you dont want to include the heavy srl include. It does prove some uniqness anyways.

Love
-Can

Ps, thanks once more for the feedback and support!

Read full topic

item.title: DryBasic
item.dc:creator: @Mad_Cow Mad Cow
item.description:
@Mad_Cow wrote:

You could use this…

[scar]procedure DryType(Text : String; Submit : Boolean);
var
D1: Integer;
begin
D1:= 1;
repeat
Wait(Random(200) + 30);
SendKeys(Copy(Text, D1, 1));
D1:= D1 + 1;
until (D1 > Length(Text));
if (Submit) then
SendKeysVB(’{ENTER}’, True);
end;[/scar]

Also DryType and DryTypeSubmit are the same thing -.-

Meh, goodluck,
Mad Cow

EDIT:

SRL already uses the HoldMouse and ReleaseMouse??

[scar]procedure Mouse(mousex, mousey, ranx, rany: Integer; left: Boolean); // By Mutant Squirrle
var
a, b, c: Integer;
begin
if (smooth) then
begin
MMouse(mousex, mousey, ranx, rany)
Wait ( 10 + Random ( 30 ));
GetMousePos(b, c);
HoldMouse(b + 1, c, left);
repeat
Wait(20 + Random(30));
a := a + 1;
until (a > 4);
GetMousePos(b, c);
ReleaseMouse(b, c, left);
end;
if (not smooth) then
begin
MMouse(mousex, mousey, ranx, rany)
Wait ( 10 + Random ( 30 ));
GetMousePos(b, c);
ClickMouse(b, c, left);
end;
Wait(clicktiming + Random(clicktimingran));
end;[/scar]

->

[scar] HoldMouse(b + 1, c, left);
repeat
Wait(20 + Random(30));
a := a + 1;
until (a > 4);
GetMousePos(b, c);
ReleaseMouse(b, c, left);[/scar]

Read full topic

item.title: DryBasic
item.dc:creator: @Can Can
item.description:
@Can wrote:

Hello there, it uses getmousepos so you dont need it. I could always change it offcourse in a later realease if people like it the other way around. But right now I cant see a reason to do it?

-Can

Read full topic

item.title: DryBasic
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

Just wondering, wouldn’t you need to declare what coordinate variables you are using in the click procedure parameters? Because sometimes I use my own. Or does it use GetMousePos?

But nice research, I’m sure this will be useful.
